subject: Self Care
title: The Isolation Trap
description: A 60-second lesson on The Isolation Trap.

hook.text: When something goes wrong, your first thought is 'Why me?' That question isolates. 'Who else?' connects.

buildup.text: Self-criticism tells you that you're uniquely flawed. That belief creates shame, and shame demands isolation.

discovery.text: BrenÃ© Brown's research shows that shame cannot survive being spoken aloud. Connection dissolves it.

twist.text: The thing you're most ashamed of is likely the thing most people can relate to. Vulnerability creates belonging.

climax.text: Share your struggle with one trusted person. Watch the shame shrink when it meets empathy instead of judgment.

punchline.text: Shame grows in silence. Speak it and it shrinks.
